current.benefit_section_tagline: Ease digestive troubles and balance gut flora with a potent blend of live probiotics, botanical extracts and vitamin D3.
current.first_benefit_content: Lactobacillus paracasei CNCM I-1572 or LP-DG™ is a popular probiotic strain known for its ability to improve digestive health by restoring beneficial gut microflora and supporting a healthy inflammatory response. LP-DG™ is the foundation of one of the leading probiotic brands in the world and the subject of numerous human clinical studies.*
current.second_benefit_content: The Aloe Vera plant contains two important enzymes that support digestion and improve nutrient absorption by breaking down carbohydrates, starches, sugars and fat. Aloe Vera is also a source of polysaccharides that may act as a prebiotic by nourishing beneficial gut bacteria.*
current.third_benefit_content: Curcumin is derived from the potent and timeless herb turmeric, used widely in Indian cuisine. The extract we use comes from a patented process that maximizes the quality and bioavailability of curcuminoids. Human studies have shown that the anti-inflammatory benefits of Curcumin extracts support the body’s response to inflammation and reduce free radicals. Curcumin helps alleviate reduces bloating and gas, and stimulates the gallbladder to produce bile, which may help improve digestion.*
current.fourth_benefit_content: Vitamin D3 supports immune health, blood pressure, bone density, and regulates calcium balance. Produced naturally by the body when skin is exposed to the sun, Vitamin D3 is the easiest form of Vitamin D for the body to absorb.
current.explore_section_content: With our micro-shot technology you’ll enjoy nutrient-rich probiotic liquid shots. Always fresh. No refrigeration needed.
current.free_shipping_section_content: Free shipping on order of two boxes or more.
current.try_it_before_section_content: Try Before You Buy.Enjoy our complimentary Digestion Sample 2-Pack
current.faq_first_content: Probiotics are live microorganisms, often referred to as “good” bacteria, that have numerous health benefits. Good bacteria live in our digestive tract and are necessary for our bodies to function properly. Good bacteria help our body digest food, destroy disease-causing “bad” bacteria, and produce important vitamins, along with many other essential functions. Probiotics need to be living and be the same as or similar to the microorganisms that naturally live in our body to be effective.
current.faq_second_content: Taking daily probiotics supports the health of our digestive tract. This is important because a healthy digestive tract is key to maintaining overall health, preventing disease and other health problems, and recovering from illness. Probiotics do this by creating a healthy habitat of microflora in your gut—the microscopic mix of bacteria, algae and fungi. Taking daily probiotics ensures we have a healthy mix of gut bacteria so our bodies function properly.
current.faq_third_title: What’s the difference between a probiotic supplement versus probiotic foods?
current.faq_third_content: Probiotics, to be effective in humans, must be living cultures derived from mammals. Many of the probiotic cultures in foods are not derived from mammals and are not living.
current.benefir_section_tagline: Ease digestive troubles and balance gut flora with a potent blend of live probiotics, botanical extracts and vitamin D3.*

settings.title: Innovation
settings.text: We merge creativity and technology to build proven dietary health products, supported by clinical evidence, for everyday people.

settings.title: Humanity
settings.text: Born from a deep respect for people and planet, we seek to improve human health and wellbeing while alleviating symptoms and enhancing life.

settings.title: Honesty
settings.text: A trusted and ethical probiotic leader, we use only exceptional active ingredients to formulate products of unmatched quality.

settings.banner_text:
A premium probiotic backed by years of research
and creative inspiration

Brought to you by SOFAR, Italy’s leading digestive health company.
settings.section_two_content:
From Italy, a country known for its edible pleasures, and SOFAR, a company known for producing Italy’s finest digestive health products, we bring you Innovia Nectar.

SOFAR’s commitment to scientific study and advancing technology has resulted in a probiotic blend unsurpassed in efficacy and stability. Innovia Nectar delivers stabilized live cultures plus a range of active liquid ingredients in a unique micro-shot system, allowing for a true multi-action wellness product.*
settings.section_two_button_text: Learn More about The science of nectar
settings.section_three_content: Innovia strives to formulate and produce the highest quality probiotics for the health of the human microbiota and the wellbeing of people. Three guiding principles inform everything we do:

settings.enter-content: Dr. Alfonso Labruzzo, an Italian entrepreneur and technological innovator with a love for the arts, begins a collaboration in 1968 with a leading American pharmaceutical company to manufacture medical devices for gastrointestinal health.

After engineering a clever delivery solution for a ready-to-use consumer device, Dr. Labruzzo launches his first product, ClismaLax®, under the SOFAR brand, for distribution in Italy. ClismaLax®becomes a best-seller and, by adding other products to its portfolio, SOFAR becomes a leading Italian gastroenterology company.

SOFAR’s success takes off — its team of medical and sales representatives working directly with doctors, pharmacists, hospitals and clinics. Today, SOFAR employs more than 350 people, with a sales force of 150 people in Italy and around the world.

settings.enter-title: Work with L. paracasei LP-DG™ Begins
settings.enter-content: SOFAR identifies and acquires the probiotic strain LP-DG™ (Lactobacillus paracasei CNCM I-1572) for its specific anti-inflammatory and gut-modulating properties. Human clinical studies are conducted to document the ability of LP-DG™ to relieve intestinal discomfort, improve daily bowel function and rebalance the intestinal microflora.

SOFAR introduces the probiotic supplement Enterolactis® to the Italian market with a simple 8 billion dose in powder. Over 15 years later, Enterolactis® is sold in numerous distinct forms and remains the most prescribed probiotic by doctors and recommended by pharmacists in Italy. Enterolactis®, built on the beneficial effects of the single strain LP-DG™, is among the 10 leading probiotic supplement brands worldwide.

SOFAR begins launching products in other medical business divisions, including Surgery, Diagnostics and Robotics. Dr. Labruzzo personally spearheaded a project to build an intuitive laparoscopic robotic surgery system, the ALF-X®, with scientists and engineers from around the world.

The ALF-X® robotic surgery division, commenced 13 years prior, is divested and SOFAR becomes the major shareholder of TransEnterix, Inc., the beneficiary of the rebranded Senhance® surgical robotic system.

SOFAR realizes one of Dr. Labruzzo’s dreams by bringing his unique probiotic strain to the U.S. dietary supplement market.

Buoyed by the overwhelming success of drinkable Enterolactis® micro-shots in Italy — and after being voted “Product of the Year” in 2016 by consumers — SOFAR introduces Innovia™ Nectar Probiotic Micro-Shots through a new subsidiary, SOFAR Americas, Inc.

settings.title: Our Patented Cap
settings.text: Live and stable probiotics are isolated from humidity in a protective ‘alu-blister’ located in the multifunctional cap.

settings.title: Liquid Advantage
settings.text: Botanical extracts, vitamins and other nutrients are delivered in a synergistic liquid blend.

settings.title: Deliciously Effective
settings.text: By separating sensitive powders and active liquids until time of use, Innovia provides unprecedented probiotic stability and viability without refrigeration.

settings.the_power_of_probiotics_content:
The Importance of Gut Health

The human microbiome, comprised of approximately 1000 species and 100 trillion bacteria, is now thought to be a ‘virtual organ’ responsible not only for intestinal health, but also for immune response, absorption of vitamins and minerals, athletic performance and even cognitive functions.

Why Strain Matters

To create effective probiotic supplements, it is essential to use specific strains for specific applications. Because strains can be matched to the functions they support, only safe, stable and clinically documented organisms can be trusted.
settings.section_strain_content: LP-DG is a popular probiotic strain known for its ability to improve digestive health by restoring beneficial gut microflora and supporting a healthy inflammatory response. LP-DG is the foundation of one of the leading probiotic brands in the world and the subject of numerous human clinical studies.*
settings.section_difference_content: Innovia’s exclusive technology is the freshest innovation in probiotic delivery.

settings.faq_answer: Probiotics are live microorganisms, often referred to as “good” bacteria, that have numerous health benefits. Good bacteria live in our digestive tract and are necessary for our bodies to function properly. Good bacteria help our body digest food, destroy disease-causing “bad” bacteria, and produce important vitamins, along with many other essential functions. Probiotics need to be alive, stabilized and robust to properly adhere to the intestinal tract and produce beneficial health effects.

Taking daily probiotics supports the health of our digestive tract. This is important because a balanced digestive tract is key to maintaining overall health and wellness, preventing disease and boosting immune response and recovering from illness. Probiotics do this by balancing and nourishing a healthy microflora in your gut—the microscopic and bioactive ecosystem of bacteria that largely determines our general health. Taking probiotics daily ensures we have a healthy mix of gut bacteria so our bodies function properly.

settings.faq_question: What’s the difference between a probiotic supplement versus probiotic foods?
settings.faq_answer: Probiotics, to be effective in humans, are most often living cultures derived from mammals. Many of the probiotic cultures in foods are not derived from mammals, but are rather derived from plant and soil bacteria. These are often termed ‘spore forming cultures’ and behave quite differently than typical lactic acid producing strains. The most common forms of probiotics for human health are derived from either Lactobacilli or Bifidobacterium strains.

settings.faq_question: Do probiotics support my digestive system?
settings.faq_answer: Yes. Probiotics help support and improve digestion. This is because a healthy digestive tract must contain colonies of good bacteria to function properly. Good bacteria breaks down and absorbs nutrients. Probiotics help our digestive tract by maintaining or restoring the colonies of healthy bacteria needed in our gut to work effectively. Innovia™ Nectar Digestion contains the probiotic strain Lactobacillus paracasei LP-DG™, which has been shown to be clinically active in numerous research studies and one of the most widely respected human health strains ever discovered.

settings.faq_question: Can probiotics help with my diarrhea?
settings.faq_answer: Yes. Probiotics play a key role in preventing and improving diarrhea symptoms. Diarrhea occurs when the normal process of gastrointestinal absorption has been disrupted, either by an infection or by an imbalance in the bacteria in our gut, creating the general inability of our gastrointestinal tract to break down and absorb ingested nutrients. When this happens, foods and fluids pass too quickly through the digestive system, resulting in loose and watery stools three or more times a day. A common cause of diarrhea is also the use of antibiotic treatments which, while eliminating bad bacteria, also destroy healthy microflora.

Yes. Probiotics play a key role in preventing and improving diarrhea symptoms. Diarrhea occurs when the normal process of gastrointestinal absorption has been disrupted, either by an infection or by an imbalance in the bacteria in our gut, creating the general inability of our gastrointestinal tract to break down and absorb ingested nutrients. When this happens, foods and fluids pass too quickly through the digestive system, resulting in loose and watery stools three or more times a day. A common cause of diarrhea is also the use of antibiotic treatments which, while eliminating bad bacteria, also destroy healthy microflora.

settings.faq_question: I’ve taken antibiotics. When should I start taking probiotics?
settings.faq_answer: Although some health-care practitioners suggest taking probiotics after we are done with a course of antibiotics, it is also a good idea to take probiotics at the same time we take antibiotics. This is because the antibiotics work to wipe out all microorganisms in our gut, both good and bad. Taking probiotics during this time will help repopulate the good bacteria we need during this time to facilitate digestion, immunity and other health benefits of good bacteria. It will not hurt us to rebuild the good bacteria in our gut while we are eliminating the bad bacteria in our gut, and it will help our digestive tract continue to function properly. Ideally, we want to continue taking probiotics daily, but be sure to continue a course of probiotics for at least two weeks after stopping antibiotics.

settings.faq_question: Which probiotic strains are in Innovia™ Nectar and why does it matter?
settings.faq_answer: Innovia™ Nectar Digestion contains L. paracasei LP-DG CNCM I-1572, a clinically studied and superior proprietary probiotic strain of 8 billion CFU (viable cultures). The specific probiotic strain you are taking is important because it determines if the probiotic will be effective for the purpose it is consumed. The LP-DG™ probiotic strain in Innovia™ Nectar Digestion has been studied extensively in humans and has been proven especially effective in improving GI conditions by restoring and maintaining the intestinal flora affected by dietary imbalances and antibiotic therapies.

settings.faq_question: Why is Innovia™ Nectar’s micro-shot delivery system more effective for my health than liquid probiotics or dry probiotic pills?
settings.faq_answer: Innovia™ Nectar probiotics stand out among other probiotic brands because they are stable and effective over time without requiring refrigeration. Innovia™ Nectar probiotics come in a unique micro-shot system that separates the powder probiotic from the plant extract and vitamin-fortified liquid, until the moment the packaging seal is broken and the two are combined. This system keeps the probiotic fresh, dry and stable. Other probiotic products degrade faster than Innovia™ Nectar. Some require refrigeration to remain stable, and others are claimed to be room-temperature stable but with little available data to prove that the strains are still alive at the time of consumption.

settings.faq_question: When and how should Innovia™ Nectar probiotics be taken?
settings.faq_answer: Innovia™ Nectar is best when taken daily over time. Results from Innovia™ Nectar may be tangible within a few days, but expect to see improved digestion and immunity after a week to 10 days. Innovia™ Nectar is needed daily because the bacteria in our gut is constantly changing, due to the complex homeostasis of our bodies which are affected by the food we eat and the lifestyle we lead. This means we must tend to the delicate balance of the microflora in our gut, similar to how we might tend to a garden, keeping healthy plants growing while preventing an overgrowth of weeds. While it does not matter what time of day Innovia™ Nectar is taken, many Italians enjoy it in the early morning or at night prior to sleep. However, because of Innovia™ Nectar’s unique portability, many bring it along in a purse or pocket for support during the day at work, school or gym.

settings.faq_question: Is Innovia™ Nectar mostly for adults, or is it also safe for children?
settings.faq_answer: Innovia™ Nectar Digestion is designed for adults but safe for the whole family. Children over the age of four (4) can take one micro-shot per day, same as adults. There are numerous safety and dosing studies that have been conducted on the active strain in Innovia™ Nectar, L. paracasei LP-DG™, including more recent studies on infants age 0-6 months.

settings.faq_question: What constitutes a good or high quality probiotic strain?
settings.faq_answer: Not all probiotic organisms are the same in terms of their health benefits or lasting effects, and not all probiotics of the same genus and species behave in the same way. It is essential to seek a ‘strain specific’ probiotic that has been proven, in human health studies, to have a beneficial effect at a specific dose. Consumers should look not only for the genus and species (for example Lactobacillus paracasei), but also the strain ID number (such as CNCM I-1572) to ensure that the probiotic they are using has been fully characterized and purified, as well as clinically tested in human studies. Innovia™ Nectar micro-shot products contain only gold-standard, stable and viable strains, which have been selected for their scientifically proven health benefits.
